page.title: 09HOUSING ARCHITECTURE,OXSHOTT
page.content: The architecture reflects the history of the area over the last 100 years. There are very few examples of houses built before the 1880's and it was the opening of the railway in 1885 that triggered off the growth of Oxshott and its development into a "Dormitory district". In square 7,off the Leatherhead Road,there is a good example of a genuine black and white Tudor cottage which has been gentryfied. Nearly all the houses are well kept,the gardens are big and nearly all the houses are first class,with garages, driveways and some with their own swimming pools or tennis courts, some with both. In all areas there are many burgular alarms on the houses and most have individual name plates carved from wood, or in pottery or wrought iron or painted.
